reviewText: This is a disaster of a course. Whilst the topic and (presumably) the sum of competences used for this Mooc are a recipe for a rivetting result, we are faced with an out-of-date, vague tentative of intellectualising lip-servicing.The language oscillates between some frenglish, with strange pronunciations, to automatic subtitles, and ends with scripts riddled with mistakes. With the majority of the external links broken, a shortage of indication of sources (photos, books), further study is uselessly made into a challenge. No quiz, peer-review assignment, nor certificate, was available.We pass on the lack of figures, superficious if any case studies, name-dropping used instead of throughly analysed quotes, permanent advocating instead of explaining. Let us add a few misunderstandings of marxist theories, and a pervasive franco-french dirigist thinking (on this last point, what else would we expect).This course could be improved quite significantly.
Good overview though it lacks concrete and detailed examples.

Ce cours était varié dans le contenu matériel et les approches théoriques. Les limites de chaque choix étaient explicitées. Pour avoir une vision d'ensemble mais aussi approfondie et critique des enjeux urbains, c'est vraiment très satisfaisant !

u​n gran acercamiento a la historia mundial del desarrollo urbano, en general es un curso largo, sin embargo, tiene tantos referentes que de pronto algunas lecturas extra de los sociologos, geografos, hisotriadores, mencionados seraín de gran ayuda durante el proceso de aprendizaje, es dictado en ingles y frances!
thanks a lot for the very interesting presentation and the photos.
